com.pm.view

Class TaskTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • com.pm.view.TaskTile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class TaskTile
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    Class defines an active task attributes on main screen. This sets visual layout of containers with objects
    Author:
    Piotr Bunia

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskTile

        public TaskTile(Long id,
                String userId,
                String groupId,
                String title,
                String comment,
                Category category,
                LocalDate createDate,
                LocalDate finishDate,
                Priority priority,
                boolean finishStatus)
        method defines Task attributes
        Parameters:
        id - sequenced Task id
        userId - User name/nickname defined when logged into program
        groupId - retrieves defined group id used to categorize task for better management by user
        title - is a task title/subject
        comment - this is a body of the task with detailed description
        category - This is defined by user. Chosen from ENUM list.
        createDate - date of task creation
        finishDate - associated end date of the task
        priority - Chosen by user from ENUM list this defines priority
        finishStatus - this defines if task is completed or not

    • Method Detail

      • setHBox1

        public void setHBox1(Category category,
                     LocalDate createDate,
                     LocalDate finishDate,
                     Priority priority)
        method defines location and visible attributes exposed within task tile visible on a main screen
        Parameters:
        category - indicate what category was associated to the task
        createDate - indicate creation date
        finishDate - indicate finish date defined by user
        priority - show associated category to the tasks chosen by the user from ENUM list

      • setVBox1

        public void setVBox1(String title,
                     String userId,
                     String comment)
        method defines further attributes and it's location within task tile visible on a main screen
        Parameters:
        title - this defines Title of the task given by a used exposed with underline to indicate importance of this details
        userId - user name/nick that created this task
        comment - indicate text/description - body of the task in a task tile

      • setVBox2

        public void setVBox2()
        method defines buttons located in a tasks tile that are associated with Delete of the task (X) and edition of the task (E)

      • setHBox2

        public void setHBox2(boolean finishStatus)
        This method defines if task is completed or not. This is indicated by a tick box
        Parameters:
        finishStatus - user tick that off once task is completed. Once ticked entire task become gray out

      • getTheId

        public Long getTheId()
        standard Get method retrieving id of the task
        Returns:
        id

      • getGroupId

        public String getGroupId()
        standard Get method that retrieves group id associated to the task
        Returns:
        groupId

      • changeStatus

        public void changeStatus(boolean finishStatus)
        method defining status of the task (if completed or not) that is send to the server.
        Parameters:
        finishStatus - this indicates if task is completed or not

      • deleteTask

        public void deleteTask()
        method defines if task is meant to be deleted and this request is sent further into the server to delete the task

      • showEditTaskScreen

        public void showEditTaskScreen()
        method that defines as action once associated button is pressed ("E"). This invokes an existing task window allowing user to perform edition of attributes

      • checkWhenFinish

        public void checkWhenFinish(boolean finishStatus)
        method defining visual effect by setting a color. This is driven by amount of dates between creation and finish date to extinguish which tasks deadline is approaching. If task is completed and box is ticked entire task tile become gray out.
        Parameters:
        finishStatus - this defines if task is still active or is completed
